fivemat
  • Reference

    fivemat: Better formatting for R

    The fivemat package provides better formatting for R numbers. It has similar functionality to the base R functions sprintf, prettyNum and formatC, but with more features and support for locales.

    This package is primarily a port of the Javascript library d3-format.

    Installation

    fivemat is not on CRAN, you can install the development version from github with

    # install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("jrnold/fivemat")
    ## Using GitHub PAT from envvar GITHUB_PAT
    ## Downloading GitHub repo jrnold/fivemat@master
## from URL https://api.github.com/repos/jrnold/fivemat/zipball/master
    ## Installing fivemat
    ## '/Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Resources/bin/R' CMD INSTALL '/private/var/folders/p9/s8k5mgx92cxfb6zgn8jlnz580000gn/T/RtmpAAYlAG/devtools1a5d50e87890/jrnold-fivemat-0d6410ad9a7b53f7c0b39ac25dc5c42cb9869be7'
    ## Reloading installed fivemat

    Usage

    The fmt function is the primary function in the package. The formatting is defined using a mini-language similar to sprintf. Some examples include:

    A rounded percentage,

    fmt(c(0.1, 0.12, 0.123, 0.1234), ".0%")
    ## [1] "10%" "12%" "12%" "12%"
    fmt(c(0.1, 0.12, 0.123, 0.1234), ".1%")
    ## [1] "10.0%" "12.0%" "12.3%" "12.3%"

    a localized fixed-point currency,

    fmt(-3.5, "($.2f", locale = "en-GB")
    ## [1] "(£3.50)"
    fmt(-3.5, "($.2f", locale = "en-US")
    ## [1] "($3.50)"

    a space-filled and signed number,

    fmt(42, "+20")
    ## [1] "                 +42"

    a dot-filled and centered number,

    fmt(42, ".^20")
    ## [1] ".........42........."

    a SI-prefixed number with two significant digits,

    fmt(42e6, ".2s")   # SI-prefix with two significant digits, "42M"
    ## [1] "42M"

    a prefixed lowercase hexadecimal number,

    fmt(48879, "#x")
    ## [1] "0xbeef"

    a number grouped by thousands with two-significant digits,

    fmt(4223, ",.2r")
    ## [1] "4,223"

    The locale argument supports localization of groupings, decimal marks, numerals,

    x <- 12345678910.12
fmt(x, "$,.2f", locale = "en-US")
    ## [1] "$12,345,678,910,.12.12"
    fmt(x, "$,.2f", locale = "en-GB")
    ## [1] "£12,345,678,910,.12.12"
    fmt(x, "$,.2f", locale = "en-IN")
    ## [1] "\u20b91,23,45,67,89,10,.12.12"
    fmt(x, "$,.2f", locale = "fr-FR")
    ## [1] "12.345.678.910..12,12 €"
    fmt(x, "$,.2f", locale = "ar-SA")
    ## [1] "١٢٬٣٤٥٬٦٧٨٬٩١٠٬.١٢٫١٢ ر.س."
    fmt(x, "$,.2f", locale = "zh-CN")
    ## [1] "¥12,345,678,910,.12.12"
    fmt(x, "$,.2f", locale = "ja-JP")
    ## [1] "12,345,678,910,.12.12円"

    The available default locales are in the fmt_locales. The default locales are those provided by the d3-format Javascript library.

    The si argument can be used to apply a common SI-prefix to all the values.

    fmt(c(0.00042, 0.0042), spec = ",.0", si = 1e-6)
    ## [1] "420μ"   "4,200μ"

    Formats can be saved as a function to be reused,

    formatter <- fmt_new(",.2f")
formatter(c(1, 100, 1000, 1050, 1.50))
    ## [1] "1.00"     "100.00"   "1,000.00" "1,050.00" "1.5.50"
    formatter(rnorm(5))
    ## [1] "0,.45,422,200,745,782.45"    "--1,.10,963,637,448,522.11" 
## [3] "--0.,949,684,418,995,494.95" "--0.,581,115,063,970,204.58"
## [5] "0.,422,849,556,195,346.42"
